release.action: Use Jetty 9.3 as embedded Jetty
Fix some typos in the user interface.
MalformedURLException when loading temp config file in Windows.
Changes in Jetty version not read after next launch.
Avoid verification of DTDs via Internet.
Problem when M2Eclipse is not installed.
Support for Jetty 9.3
Added sample projects for testing different features in Jetty versions.
The certificate should be issued for localhost instead of EclipseJettyPlugin
Support for Jetty 9.1.x and 9.2.x
Now WebApp without web.xml can be used (Jetty 9 recommended).
Fixed relative path extraction for webapp path and context file location.
Added selection dialog, if multiple Web App directories were found.
Added option for graceful shutdown.
Fixed some minor UI glitches (table not scaling, max width,...). Beautified it a here and there. If it isn't the best launcher, it should be the best looking one ;)
Added local server URLs to simplify the main tab.
Added a filter for dependencies.
Added server and client cache options.
Added tool tips for all options.
Added Run As... and Debug As... option.
Added web defaults option.
Updated advanced configuration tab layout.
Added acceptor and thread pool limits.
Unified file and folder access code.
DEV: Fixed package building task.
Fixed the sitemap and added a favicon.
Added the info command to the console, that shows the launch info.
Added the restart command to the console.
Added the stop command to console, to stop the server gracefully.
Added the open command to console, to open a browser.
Added the dump command to console, to dump the state of Jetty.
Added the exit command to console.
Added the echo command, just for fun.
Added the help command.
Added the mbean command, to access mbeans.
Added the memory command, to show memory statistics and perform a garbage collection.
Added the prop command, to show and modify system properties.
Added the thread command, to show thread statistics.
Moved context table to options tab to simplify main tab.
Moved dependencies table to separate tab to make room for connection limit option.
Added connection limit option.
Added scan button for WebApp Directory.
Added automatic detection of WebApp Directory.

Added console feature. Now you can talk to your Jetty via the Eclipse Console and do things like: stopping the server gracefully, dumping the state, change properties and much more. If you like give it a snack.
Enabled JMX Support option
Eclipse 3.3 and 3.4 weren't even supported since some time. Reenabled 3.4 at least (3.3 misses some basic UI functions). Updated dependency definitions accordingly.
Added "Open..." link for Jetty configs
Fixed external Jetty configs - but dropped support for Eclipse 3.2 (sorry, but's time to grade up!)
Fixed support for Jetty 9
Added basic HTTPs support
Added visual sugar
Added direct m2e support for correct Maven scopes
Embedded Jetty is now version 8
Added some more docs
Added Jetty context file handling
Support for Jetty 9 added.
Added table for exlcludes/includes - no regex anymore
Added Jetty provided by plugin.
Support for Jetty 8 added.
Support for Jetty 5 dropped.
Fixed Jetty version autodetection.
Jetty home can now be set via a variable.
Support for m2e-plugin: you can configure the scopes included in classpath (defaults to compile and runtime).
Webapp libraries are now loaded via Jetty classloader mechanism and not globally set as classpath (can be triggered optionally).
Classpath for webapp is now set via file - no problems with too long command line in Windows anymore :)
New logo with a shiny glow.
Refactored and beautified UI
Jetty 7 compatability.
Enable JSP Support: JSP support and version can be selected in the run configuration.
Excluded libraries can now be edited - default value is ".*servlet-api.*, .*selenium-server.*standalone\.jar"
Jetty 5 and 6 compatability.
